channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12981] ThriftCLIService uses incompatible getShortName() implementation
item.description:
ThriftCLIService has a local implementation getShortName() that assumes a short name is always the part before "@" and "/". This is not always the case as Kerberos Rules (from Hadoop's KerberosName) might actually transform a name to something else.

Considering a pending change to getShortName() (#HADOOP-12751) and the normal use of KerberosName in other parts of Hive it only seems logical to use the standard implementation.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This patch is against 1.2.1, small change is needed to apply against 2.1.0 due to signature change of getUserName.
I am re-attaching the same patch with a different name so that HiveQA would pick it and run the tests.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12787304/HIVE-12981.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12787304 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
sershe would you mind helping on what I am doing wrong with the patch format? I followed the guidelines (I think) after your adjustment, but mine does not seem to be picked up.

It looks like you remembered to cancel the previous patch and resubmit, so that's okay.

Just guessing here: maybe your patch name has too many leading zeros on "0001". I've seen patches without any leading zeros in that position and patches with one leading zero (such as HIVE-12878 and HIVE-12994) but don't recall any with this many.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12787839/HIVE-12981.01.patch

leftylev Thanks, changing the leading zeros seems to have done the job.

To me it seems the errors from the tests are unrelated. Will attach again.

2016-02-14T04:29:20,475 ERROR [d525a051-6f72-48f6-bf9e-4b42913536a3 main[]]: ql.Driver (SessionState.java:printError(1025)) - FAILED: Execution Error, return code -101 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.FunctionTask. UDFExampleAdd : Unsupported major.minor version 52.0

I've documented the leading-zeros issue in the wiki. (If anyone has additional information, please let me know or put it in the wiki.)

  • How To Contribute – Precommit Tests by Hive QA
Cancel and resubmit is not actually necessary, it's ok to submit another patch without changing the status.
CTE tests, partition_coltype_literals, and the last two fail elsewhere (CTE should already be fixed).
sershe So is there anything left to do for this patch? testCliDriver_ivyDownload is I guess also not due to this patch.
